threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (65536u), with no line terminators

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation

Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "AccessVBOM" to a value of "1" which disables trust access for VBA on the victim machine and lets attackers execute malicious macros without any Microsoft Office warnings.
Detects changes to Microsoft Office protected view registry keys with which the attacker disables this feature.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Hashes=SHA1=85E046DE3C2DE1B4C85E57BA00CF7151B3D59F24,MD5=D857FA7279E2861199583474C17A1C6C,SHA256=DDDE64F0F55751763C1BCD53DE9CDFFC0D725D45A8476464A2A0422661813004,IMPHASH=44E70F20C235C150D75F6FC8B1E29CD1; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe" /Create /RU system /SC ONLOGON /TN Microsoft\WindowsMalwareByteSDK /TR "wscript C:\ProgramData\SYSTEM32SDK\ConfManagerNT.vbs" /F; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=85E046DE3C2DE1B4C85E57BA00CF7151B3D59F24,MD5=D857FA7279E2861199583474C17A1C6C,SHA256=DDDE64F0F55751763C1BCD53DE9CDFFC0D725D45A8476464A2A0422661813004,IMPHASH=44E70F20C235C150D75F6FC8B1E29CD1; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=schtasks.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Task Scheduler Configuration Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\schtasks.exe" /Create /RU system /SC ONLOGON /TN Microsoft\WindowsMalwareByteSDK /TR "wscript C:\ProgramData\SYSTEM32SDK\ConfManagerNT.vbs" /F; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=A5FF3845B0F55157C4AEA35E9EAE213560ACDB5C,MD5=A243BC9DB0BFB5F22E146B88BB10C58F,SHA256=0758152947F1A550E52CE8E3F9BCD988A23D36A458AD953795769B11C38FF2EA,IMPHASH=2CB38FE7D8F223D9DA50B7CBA9B95A6D; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=ATTRIB.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Attribute Utility; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\attrib.exe" +s +h C:\ProgramData\SYSTEM32SDK\ConfManagerNT.vbs; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\attrib.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=A5FF3845B0F55157C4AEA35E9EAE213560ACDB5C,MD5=A243BC9DB0BFB5F22E146B88BB10C58F,SHA256=0758152947F1A550E52CE8E3F9BCD988A23D36A458AD953795769B11C38FF2EA,IMPHASH=2CB38FE7D8F223D9DA50B7CBA9B95A6D; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=ATTRIB.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Attribute Utility; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\attrib.exe" +s +h C:\ProgramData\SYSTEM32SDK\ProjectConfManagerNT.ini; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\attrib.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "VBAWarning" to a value of "1" which enables the execution of all macros, whether signed or unsigned.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Command Patterns In Scheduled Task Creation
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects scheduled task creation using "schtasks" that contain potentially suspicious or uncommon commands
